Acceptance Criteria: Given empty database, When migration runs, Then all tables use UUID PKs with proper indexes
Given hardcoded secrets, When refactored, Then all secrets from .env only
Given unauthenticated API, When auth added, Then all endpoints require valid JWT
Given tinyllama loaded, When config updated, Then backend uses tinyllama not gpt-oss
Given 98 files with 66% duplication, When cleaned, Then single canonical location

Story: Convert AI Orchestrator stub to functional
Acceptance Criteria: Given stub returning fake data, When implemented, Then real task orchestration
Given stub agent, When implemented, Then coordinates multiple agents
Given no code analysis, When implemented, Then reviews code using tinyllama
Given no doc search, When implemented, Then RAG-based Q&A
Given no inter-agent comms, When implemented, Then agents exchange messages
Given isolated ChromaDB, When integrated, Then documents searchable
Given unconfigured Kong, When routes added, Then proper API gateway
Given no upload, When implemented, Then docs uploaded and embedded
Given basic metrics, When dashboards created, Then agent performance visible
Given silent failures, When tracking added, Then errors logged and alerted
Given no tests, When tests added, Then 80% coverage
Given auth system, When tests added, Then auth flows verified
Given no benchmarks, When tests run, Then performance baselines established
Given unlimited requests, When limited, Then 60 req/min per user
Given raw input, When validation added, Then sanitized input only
Given no roles, When RBAC added, Then role-based access
Given manual deployment, When scripted, Then one-command deploy
Given manual process, When automated, Then PR checks and auto-deploy
Given basic health, When enhanced, Then component-level health

Story: Update all docs to reflect reality
Acceptance Criteria: Given fantasy docs, When updated, Then accurate documentation
Given no API docs, When created, Then OpenAPI spec
Given no user docs, When created, Then end-user guide
